post: How do you teach civic responsibility through real service? Retired Colonol Michael Komorous talks with our own Gerald Gangaram about his career in the Air Force, his time working in legislative affairs at the Pentagon, and his desire to continue to highlight veterans' stories on his podcast, Voice for Valor. 🎥 Watch:  https://bit.ly/4msQS4N  #CivicVirtue  #LeadershipDevelopment  #VeteranVoices  #MentorshipMatters

#OTD 1965, the Voting Rights Act was signed into law, protecting Black citizens from racial discrimination at the ballot box. 🗳 Why does voting access still matter? What was it like for George Washington to show courage? What does it mean for you to show courage?  In this back-to-school conversation, Joe Schmidt shares how the Bill of Rights Institute equips teachers to connect current events to constitutional principles and civic virtues, without partisanship. From classroom-ready support during the school year to real-time help with big, timely questions like Why is this in the news? , BRI is meeting educators where they are. 🎥 Watch the full conversation:  https://bit.ly/4fbJZCi  #CivicEducation  #EducationLeadership  #BackToSchool  #SocialStudies

Discover the tensions of the hours before Operation Overlord, the words Gen. Eisenhower prepared in case of failure, and the quiet, resolute character that defined his command. From late-night meetings with Churchill and Montgomery to visits with young paratroopers hours before they jumped into enemy territory, witness the story of a leader who rose to the moment and helped shape the course of history. This mini-documentary is part of our Celebrating A250 series, which highlights important moments in the 250+ years of United States history.  https://bit.ly/4lKPcDF

BRI Senior Fellow, Tony Williams, recently interviewed author James Graham Wilson to examine the life and legacy of Paul Nitze, a key architect of Cold War national security policy. Drawing from his book Americas Cold Warrior: Paul Nitze and National Security from Roosevelt to Reagan, Wilson explores how Nitzes decades-long public service reflected a deep commitment to American ideals and the defense of liberty in the nuclear age. Watch it today!  https://bit.ly/4mfNXwe
